intro: Crotalaria paracistoides, commonly known as the parastic crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and bean-like pods. The plant has compound leaves with pairs of oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, erect flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry to moist conditions. Due to its invasive potential in some areas, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
